page.title: 01Introduction to area
page.content: This block is rural area North West of Banbury,Oxfordshire.The vast majority of the area is agricultural and contains the two villages of {Mollington and Warmington. The villages lie on either side of the Warmington Valley,which runs parallel to the line of Edge Hill to the North West. At the highest points at the sides of the valley the land is an average of 550 feet above sea level and in the valley itself 350 feet above sea level. To the South West the main Banbury to Warwick road (A41)runs atop the ridge and to the North East the Banbury to Southam road (A423)runs atop this ridge. The distance on a West/East line between the two ridges is approximately 3.5 kilometres.
